pros: Flexibility and room for advancement.
cons: Pay is on the low  but it is something we are all working on to get increased!

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Concord, NH
pros:
Helping disabled adults get active in their community.
Rewarding career.

cons:

Often forgotten you are human too

pros: School-based schedule, good supervision, training
cons: Low pay, can send you anywhere

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in New Haven, CT
pros: The friendships and love we develop with the individual(s) we provide assistance for.
cons: High turnover rate and management not enforcing staff to show up on time for shifts, staff sometimes provide the bare minimum care. Due to turnover rate, staff become burned out easily.

pros:
It was pretty exciting to get a call from The Institute of Professional Practice for employment as I struggled to get a psychology job with only a Bachelor's. You do not even need a Bachelor's degree to get this job even though it may say it is required, it is only preferred. 
Great job for people who are looking for a psychology job without a Master's degree.
Benefits are really good and very affordable.
Job can feel rewarding when reminding oneself they are changing lives everyday. 
Paid vacations and snow days.
cons:
This company is very disorganized and allows too much flexibility. This may sound really nice in the beginning, until you are thrown into a situation where you have no idea how to respond. Sometimes it feels like you are baby sitting rather than modifying behavior, because the programs written out for these children just don't seem right. But the quality of training also depends on what school you are in. 
The pay is horrible for the amount of stress you go through in a day.  
Be ready to change diapers, YES CHANGE DIAPERS at least three times a day, get bitten, spat on, and all disgusting things under the sun. 
The job isn't just for anyone. You really have to be a certain kind of breed and have a niche to do this kind of work. 
I just don't think the pay is anywhere near the amount stress one goes through.

pros: Weekends off, salaried and overtime available.
cons: Managers were not supportive, culture was bad. High turnover rate.

review_title: the life of DSP at IPP
pros: staff that truly cares for the clients
cons: awful managemnt .no opportunity for growth. low pay meaning you will need to get a second job. coming to work you dont know what kind of day youll have.clients have behavior and stress from managemnt. its just too much. the clients depend on you for everything. eating,cooking,bathing and thats not including worrying about your own family and house.  if your co worker is lazy well you have to pick up his slack or you could get fired.  awful awful place to work...people are quitting everyday month or so .because its just too much... if your a hard worker manager will work you to death until you quit..alot of favoritism ..manager dont really  care for you

review_title: Mostly positive, but the job was not what I expected.
job_title: Applied Behavior Analysis Therapist in Meriden, CT
pros: Extensive training in restraint and applied behavior analysis techniques, working one on one with an autistic child and being able to develop a rapport with that child.
cons: No bathroom breaks unless the child is left with another therapist, having to keep records of progress manually instead of entering it into a computer.

pros: This position is great for someone who wants to get their feet wet in the behavioral/mental health field through working with children. The school schedule is also awesome (the adults pray more for snow days than the kids-- it's great). In at 7am and out at 3pm for middle school and I believe it may be an earlier arrival/dismissal for high school students. No weekends or late nights unless you sign up for an after-school program or something like that. The kids can really make you smile on the good days. They are just adorable!
cons:
Hours can also be bad as the summer hours are often lessened due to the kids not being in school. If you are in a salary position, you may have a few weeks in the summer that you don't get to work. Summer school hours are available, however, it was distributed to those who were in the position longer, first. 

Also, I felt extremely micromanaged in this position. There is not really that you get to do on your own, despite spending so much time with the child. Also, in Stratford, the teacher was pretty lax, leaving the ABA therapists to come up with a lot of activities that should have been pre-planned.

Not a lot of room for personal growth and development. Also, the days can be very boring as the work is not always challenging. Now don't get me wrong, it is certainly a stressful job at times (depending on the clients/populations) but it can also be unchallenging and slow moving.

review_title: Prejudice and Unfair at the learning academy in Meriden!
pros: The company offered tons of training. I was new to working with individuals with autism, I took everything they taught me & landed a better job quickly!
cons: My handbag was searched, I was watched like a hawk, spoken to as if I was not intelligent by my supervisor. I went to the principle to discuss these problems and she did nothing but spread my business around the school.

pros: Not sitting at a desk all day, getting to go on fun outings like to the park, lake, mall, indoor soccor center, out to lunch, helping clients to have active, social lives, paid mileage, flexible hours, off early, nights and weekends free, support from above, fun coworkers, easy low stress work, days go by quickly, some good trainings
cons: Immature supervisors, low pay, some days were unorganized, some staff dressed too casually and looked unprofessional

pros:
-Friendly staff
-Professional and thorough training period
-Supervisors are very knowledgeable 
-Great learning experience, you learn the ins and outs of ABA
cons: -I started as a substitute ABA therapist, therefore I had to travel to different schools. As a substitute it is hard to get to know the students, but all the staff was very helpful and welcoming.

review_title: Fair and Good place to work

pros: Good Environment, Friendly Staff, Fulfilling to those who are good at their job,

pros: Team of dedicated professionals who support each other and have a passion for greatness in meeting the needs of our clients.
